column3: A large and realistic likeness of John Wayne and his horse.It's really gorgeous and a must-see.George Vreeland Hill
The Horseman is a splendid statue of John Wayne, the interesting story about where it is and who owned the building is fun (Hustler), worth locating.

column2: The Duke as he is remembered
column3: This is a fine monument to the star, who is clad in a cowboy outfit and astride a purposeful horse. Around the plinth are numerous ranching scenes such as cattle drives.Harry Jackson, its sculptor, became friends with the actor in 1969. The sculpture was unveiled in 1984.
